description.narrative: The most significant, expected project-level outcome is an increase in the supply and delivery of quality crop-specific fertilizer for smallholder farmers in Uganda. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that its investment will increase competitiveness in the country's fertilizer sector by changing the market structure through demonstration and replication effects, capacity building and skill development.

The proposed investment is an A Loan of up to US$11 million to Grainpulse Limited (Grainpulse or the Company) in Uganda. The Company engages in coffee and grain supply chain management, human and animal nutrition, and is also the pioneer in local fertilizer blending in the country. The investment will support the Companys ongoing US$17.6 million expansion program which will be complemented by an advisory services program to support smallholder farmers, agro-input dealers and retailers in the country (the Project). The Project may be supported by IFC as the implementing entity of the Private Sector Window of the Global Agriculture and Food Security Program (GAFSP).
